metadata.title: CVE-2020-25671 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in Linux Kernel, where a refcount leak inllcp_sock_connect() causing use-after-free which might lead to privilegeescalations.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1074-fips - 4.4.0-1074.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
